communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records or emails pertaining to Cisco Gomez. Focusing in on his position as Maintenance and Grounds Supervisor. Looking for information related to complaints about him from staff. Include any emails from John Mannix, Karen Mooseker, Keith Stefenson and District Office staff that have anything to do about any complaints from staff against Cisco Gomez. Between the years of 2015 to 2022. 
Any records or emails pertaining to Amber Donovan that have anything to do with lewd texting and videos being sent to subordinates. Focusing in on her position as Custodial manager, Coordinator. Between the years of 2020 to 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rex Anthony Sites

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Washington Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Dec. 8, 2022. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

On behalf of the district's Public Records Officer Simone Neal, and pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, this email acknowledges receipt of the public records request you submitted to the Mukilteo School District on December 8, 2022.  Specifically, you requested:

"Any records or emails pertaining to Cisco Gomez. Focusing in on his position as Maintenance and Grounds Supervisor. Looking for information related to complaints about him from staff. Include any emails from John Mannix, Karen Mooseker, Keith Stefenson and District Office staff that have anything to do about any complaints from staff against Cisco Gomez. Between the years of 2015 to 2022."

"Any records or emails pertaining to Amber Donovan that have anything to do with lewd texting and videos being sent to subordinates. Focusing in on her position as Custodial manager, Coordinator. Between the years of 2020 to 2022."

The district is processing your request.  The district anticipates that the first installment of records responsive to your request will be available no later than February 1, 2023.  This additional time is necessary, per RCW 42.56.520, to locate and assemble the information requested, to determine whether any of the information you requested is exempt from public disclosure and produce a corresponding exemption log, and to notify any third party affected by the request.  As documents responsive to your request are ready for disclosure, they will be provided to you.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney
Director of Human Resources
Mukilteo School District
9401 Sharon Drive
Everett, Washington 98204
425-356-1298
barneykd@mukilteo.wednet.edu<mailto:barneykd@mukilteo.wednet.edu>
Pronouns: he/him/his

Employment Opportunities - https://www.mukilteoschools.org/Page/937

[Image]

The information transmitted is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or privileged material, the disclosure of which is governed by applicable law. Any review, retransmission, dissemination or other use of, or taking of any action in reliance upon, this information by persons or entities other than the intended recipient is prohibited. If you received this in error, please contact the sender and destroy the materials contained in this message.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

In my December 15, 2022, email to you in response to your December 8, 2022 request for records, I estimated the first installment of those records would be available to you by February 1, 2023.

In our subsequent search for records, we have found over 23,300 email records that may be responsive to your request for "Any records or emails pertaining to Cisco Gomez. Focusing in on his position as Maintenance and Grounds Supervisor. Looking for information related to complaints about him from staff. Include any emails from John Mannix, Karen Mooseker, Keith Stefenson and District Office staff that have anything to do about any complaints from staff against Cisco Gomez. Between the years of 2015 to 2022."

With the way your request is worded and in order to provide you with all the emails you are requesting, we will need to review each one of the 23,300 records to determine if they are responsive and possibly make redactions to the records.  This will take a significant amount of time.  Therefore, we invite you to narrow your request.  Are there any more specific terms you would like to provide regarding specific complaints or individuals for whom you are looking for records?

If you would like to proceed with your request as written, please let me know and I will update the expected timeline for processing the request.  I look forward to receiving a reply from you about how you would like to proceed with your request.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

Per RCW 42.56. 250(12), I am providing you with a copy of the third party notification to Ms. Carnahan (formerly Donovan), as attached hereto.

Please note, the record has been redacted per RCW 42.56.230(3).  Ms. Carnahan's personal email address has been redacted because disclosing it would violate her right to privacy.  Please also note that, due to a delay in providing the notification and the need to provide her with 10 days' notice before releasing the records, our initial installment of responsive records will be delayed approximately one week, to February 9,, 2023.

Finally, please see my previous email below regarding a possible narrowing of the other item from your December 8, 2022 request, to which you have not yet responded.  Have a good day.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

Attached is the first installment of records responsive to your request for "Any records or emails pertaining to Amber Donovan that have anything to do with lewd texting and videos being sent to subordinates. Focusing in on her position as Custodial manager, Coordinator. Between the years of 2020 to 2022."  A redaction log is also included.

The district will continue its search for records for this request and also for "Any records or emails pertaining to Cisco Gomez. Focusing in on his position as Maintenance and Grounds Supervisor. Looking for information related to complaints about him from staff. Include any emails from John Mannix, Karen Mooseker, Keith Stefenson and District Office staff that have anything to do about any complaints from staff against Cisco Gomez. Between the years of 2015 to 2022."

As another reminder, on January 25 I invited you to narrow your search to help expedite the search for records responsive to the Cisco Gomez item above.  After further searching, we have reduced the number of potentially responsive email records to 12,810, which will take a significant amount of time to review.  Absent an updated request to revise our search, we will continue to search based on your original request.

At this time. we anticipate a second installment of records will be sent to you no later than April 1, 2023.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney

communications.subject: Response to Request for Records Final Installment
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

In response to your request for records dated December 8, 2022, the district is providing you with a final installment of records. The records include emails regarding an investigation which is responsive to your request for "Any records or emails pertaining to Amber Donovan that have anything to do with lewd texting and videos being sent to subordinates. Focusing in on her position as Custodial manager, Coordinator. Between the years of 2020 to 2022." An exemption log accompanies the records.

The files are too large to send through the district email system. I have placed them in a shared Google folder at this link<https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1ePO1abTLfGk68b0UmSOnUgGhgkZ72DXr?usp=drive_link>. You may access, view and download the records. Be sure to save them for your use. The folder will remain accessible for 30 days or until October 26, 2023.

Let me know if you have any questions about the records.

With this response, the district considers this request closed.

Sincerely,

Tammy Bengen, Executive Assistant for
Assistant Superintendent Equity, Engagement & Academics and
Assistant Superintendent Business, Human Resources & Technology
9401 Sharon Dr. | Everett, WA 98204
bengentl@mukilteo.wednet.edu<mailto:bengentl@mukilteo.wednet.edu>

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: LAUSD Contractor Protocol
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documents pertaining to each Department's, each Division's, protocols, requirements, SOP's, regarding the payment of LAUSD contractors, day laborers, and vendors.
Scans in PDF format of the complete manual for software or all methods of payment transmittal. 
For instances where schools or the District (LAUSD) pays contractors, day laborers, vendors, in person or by mail I request documents scanned to PDF format displaying standard operating protocols, requirements, procedures as well. This should be done on a school by school basis with point of contact, and where all necessary by Department with point of contact.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Remy Noìchlaf

communications.subject: Auto Reply
communications.communication:
Hello,

This email is in response to your California Public Records Act (PRA) request.  Your request will be reviewed and the appropriate departments contacted to determine if disclosable records relevant to your request exist.

As required under California Code section 7922.535(a), the Los Angeles Unified School District (District) will make a determination within 10 days as to whether or not a request is seeking records that are publicly disclosable and, if so, to provide the estimated date that the records will be made available.  There is no requirement for a public agency to actually produce the records within 10 days of receiving a request, unless the requested records are readily available.  Still, the District prides itself on always providing all publicly disclosable records in as timely a manner as possible.

Should you have any questions, please contact the Office of the General Counsel at (213) 241-7600.

Thank you.

PLEASE DO NOT RESPOND TO THIS EMAIL.

As required under California Government Code section 7922.525, the District will make a determination within 10 days as to whether or not a request is seeking records that are publicly disclosable and, if so, to provide the estimated date that the records will be made available. communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Search Warrant records (Chicago Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records related to all search warrants executed between Jan 2012 and the date of processing this request:

IR #
Search Warrant #
Type of Warrant
Search Warrant Date
Search Warrant Requested Address
Search Warrant Execution Address
Complaint For Search Warrant Date
Whether Arrest Occurred
Requesting Officer
Approving Watch Commander
District/Unit
Recovery (Y/N)
Arrest (Y/N)
Name of Judge Who Approved
Time of Judge Approval
Whether Contraband Found in Unusual Location
Whether a Warrant Team Vest Was Used

The records for this request exist in CLEAR, and the processing of this request should be handled nearly identically to P494685, with the exception of the new requested fields: https://www.muckrock.com/foi/chicago-169/search-warrant-log-chicago-police-department-73550/

The information from this request may require the drafting of SQL, as has been done in the past for similar requests. 

To be clear, 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matt Chapman

Your FOIA request requires the collection of a substantial number of documents.   Perhaps, you can

a response  being delayed.

communications.subject: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request #P518853-082919
communications.communication:
I am well aware of the volume of requests that CPD receives.

The information responsive to this request is far too important for the public's understanding of CPD's activities, and as such, I am not interested in reducing the scope of this request. In your continued handling of this request, bear in mind that your department has passed the statutory time limit that allows the use of the unduly burdensome exemption.

I look forward to receiving these records ASAP.

communications.subject: Search warrant help.
communications.communication:
Hello, 

I recently did a google search of city of Chicago search warrants and came across your FOIA request from the city of Chicago. 

My daughter was a victim of the Chicago police because of the way they obtained the search warrant.

Is there a way you can please help me get all the actual complaints for search warrants and search warrants that involve the 25th and 14th districts in Chicago, IL.

The officers involved were Ivan Ramos who is a sergeant who approved the warrants. (37 year old who was promoted by merit votes who runs a tactical team) Samantha Grazziano who wrote the complaint for the warrant (4 year police officer who is on a tactical team) and judge Ursula Walowski who signed the warrant. 

Ivan ramos gets most of his warrants signed by Judge  Ursula Walowski who lives in the northwest side of Chicago where a lot of Chicago cops live. Her son goes to a private catholic school named St. Thecla where many Chicago police officers children attend as well.

Samantha Grazziano who wrote the complaint for the search warrant lives about 2 miles from the judge Ursula Walowski.

Samantha Grazziano’s best friend who is also a Chicago police officer mother who was a Chicago police officer Elizabeth Mcghee lives like 4 blocks away from Judge Ursula Walowski.

I don’t have any concrete proof as of yet about how they conspire but I have a feeling that either Ursula Walowski is rubber stamping the search warrants or the officers are forging her signature.

I know it’s kind of unbelievable but I do have proof that is public record of an officer that was forging Judge Ursula Walowski’s signature so that he would be approved overtime hours that he never worked for.

Can you please get back to me as I’m in desperate need to gather proof that would help my daughters case so she can be set free.

Thank you,
Dominick P.
Sent from my iPhone

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: P561364-013020
communications.communication:
Dear Matt : 
Thank you for your interest in information from the Chicago Police Department. Your FOIA request has been received and is being processed. Your FOIA Center reference number for tracking purposes is: P561364-013020 
You have requested the following records: Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All names of all CLEAR modules.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matt Chapman, as Lucy Parsons Labs

You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the Chicago FOIA Center.

On Jan. 30, 2020:
Subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: P561364-013020
Dear Matt : 
Thank you for your interest in information from the Chicago Police Department. Your FOIA request has been received and is being processed. Your FOIA Center reference number for tracking purposes is: P561364-013020 
You have requested the following records: Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:
All names of all CLEAR modules.
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.
I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.
Sincerely,
Matt Chapman, as Lucy Parsons Labs

title: Long Beach Fire Department Sworn Employees Zip Codes

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Long Beach Fire Department Sworn Employees Zip Codes
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

—Documents sufficient to show the zip code and city of residence of every sworn employee of the Long Beach Fire Department.*

*I have made this same request of the LBPD as PRA request P005736 (filed January 6, 2021, fulfilled August 31, 2021). The LBPD responded by providing a PDF with two columns (city and zip code) and a row for each officer. The LBPD data shows 81.5% of officers commute from outside Long Beach—many from Covid-19 hotspot in Orange County and one from as far away as Texas. 

This request is in line with the precedent the ACLU and LA Times have established with the LAPD's public records department.  If you prefer not to make a seperate list, I will accept a redacted copy of the LBFD call-out roster or other such document. 

The requested data will be made available to the general public and will appear in the Beachcomber and other media outlets as part of their reporting on the Public Safety Unions' opposition to Covid-19 public health measures. This request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Greg Buhl

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: C012519-100321
communications.communication:
Dear Greg Buhl: 
 
Thank you for submitting a request for public records to the City of Long Beach. Pursuant to California Government Code § 6253, staff will review your request and respond within 10 days to notify you if there are responsive records, or if an extension is necessary to determine whether responsive records exist. 
If your request was received after business hours or on a weekend or holiday, the next business day will be considered the date of receipt. The 10-day response period starts with the first calendar day after the date of receipt (Ca. Civ. Code, § 10). 
You may be contacted by a City staff member if there are questions regarding your request. 
Thank you again for contacting the City of Long Beach. You may track the status of your request here in My Request Center.

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: C012519-100321
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: Public Records Request Reference Number: C012519-100321 
Thank you for submitting your request for public records.  Occasionally, we experience a delay in searching for records.  Consequently, pursuant to Government Code 6253 (c), the City of Long Beach is extending the time within which to identify responsive documents by fourteen (14) calendar days. 
The City will make every effort to provide responsive records in a reasonable time.  You will be notified by October 28, 2021 of the following: 
 
  * Whether the City has records responsive to your request, and the page count and required payment, if applicable, to produce copies of such records, and/or 
  * Whether the City has records responsive to your request, but which are exempt from disclosure and the reasons for exemption. 
If you have any questions, please contact the Records Coordinator Office at (562) 570-6711.

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: C012519-100321
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: Public Records Request Reference Number: C012519-100321 
Dear Greg Buhl, 
In response to PRA # C012519-100321 received on 10/3/2021, the City of Long Beach has determined that responsive records exist and will be disclosed.  City staff is working on compiling and reviewing the appropriate documents and will produce them promptly within a reasonable time frame. Staff will notify you upon producing records if portions of documents will be withheld from disclosure due to exemptions in accordance with law. 
Thank you for contacting the City of Long Beach.  If you have any questions, please call (562) 570-6680. 
Thank you,

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: C012519-100321
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Hi, Mr. Buhl, 
Fire is working on gathering these records. They've had a lot of turnover in their admin staff lately, and have recruited someone from another Department to help them with their PRA backlog. They recently acknowledged that they know they owe me records to then forward to you for this. I'll most certainly release as soon as I receive them. 
Best, 
Megan Felix

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA Logs (06/01/2023-present)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Complete FOIA logs between June  01, 2023 and the date this request is processed (inclusive of those dates).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Niles Coalition

communications.communication:
Hello,

I do not have the exact stop date and the only information I found is attached and below. These are statements and documents released about two years ago in response to an Open Records Request and inquiry related to PredPol.


“Predpol was provided to the Atlanta Police Department as part of a pilot program by the Atlanta Police Foundation, which is a separate entity. We discontinued our use of the software two years later in 2016. The Atlanta Police Department did not conduct any audits during that time.”


“We discontinued use of Predpol in 2016.  Predpol was provided to our agency by the Atlanta Police Foundation, which is a separate entity.  The only documents I have been able to locate, related to Predpol, are attached to this email.”

title: Chicago Police Officer Photos (Chicago Police Department)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Chicago Police Officer Photos (Chicago Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all official police officer photos of officers in active duty
A copy of all official police officer photos of officers who left the force between 2012 and the date of processing this request.
A badge ID and full name for each CPD photo.

Please forward this request to the research division, who should be able to process this request with relative ease, similar to what they do with CLEAR SQL queries.

As the public's interest for this information is exceedingly high given current events, the public's interest far, far outweighs the burden on your office.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lucy Parsons Labs

communications.subject: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Chicago Police Officer Photos (Chicago Police Department)
communications.communication:
Hi -- pardon my late response.

Can you please share with me ways that this request can be narrowed? It's my understanding that all of these photos are stored digitally, and so are searchable. Per CPD directives, the system for maintaining ID cards is managed by the IT division, which ought to give your agency a little bit of extra technical diligence to systematically collect those records: "The Managing Deputy Director, Public Safety Information TechnologyServices Division, is responsible for programming Department identification cards to enter controlled access areas." Is that not the case?

Is there a way that we can get on a call to discuss?

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Albuquerque Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: Your City of Albuquerque public records request #23-6723 has been opened.
communications.communication:
City of Albuquerque ************************************************************************ Your record request #23-6723 has been submitted successfully. Greetings:   We have received your request for public records and will begin processing your request. This correspondence is intended to acknowledge your request and alert you that it may take up to fifteen days to process your request. NMSA 1978 14-2-8(D). We will be in contact with you as we process your request if we need additional information or if it appears that your request is excessively burdensome and broad. Please be advised, if you are requesting lapel and/or 911 audio from the Albuquerque Police Department (APD), your request may take a significant amount of time to review and provide the records. In lieu of the 911 audio, my office can provide the Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD). The CAD provides information of when the call was received, when and what officers were dispatched, and a description of what happens throughout the incident. In addition, please keep in mind a 5 minute lapel video can take up to 20 minutes to review depending on the type of redactions that are necessary to complete. Please do not hesitate to contact us if you would like to know the status of your request, and please communicate all questions and status updates via NextRequest. You may access your request by signing into your NextRequest profile at the following website:   https://nextrequest.cabq.gov/users/sign_in    If you have not created a profile, go to the following link:   https://nextrequest.cabq.gov/sign_in_help Sincerely,   Ethan Watson City Clerk ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact City of Albuquerque.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

communications.subject: FOIA:  DOI-USGS-2023-004943:  Acknowledgment of your FOIA request
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Welsh: 
On June 6, 2023, the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) office received your FOIA request dated June 6, 2023, and assigned it control number DOI-USGS-2023-004943.  Please cite this number in any future communications with our office regarding your request.  You request the following information: 
All video and image drone footage recorded during the October 2022 unmanned aerial vehicle missions in and around the Assateague Island National Seashore. 
The mission was disclosed in a flight log released via a prior FOIA request. A series of missions were recorded with the RIDs of: 
R_3dTivlqY6ccKVd7 
R_1obtsFMoC2O4CCQ 
R_3q8bodDthaQ7fKl 
R_3Dbc8tOPYfKrF0l 
R_2ciLS3wpACgWlH5 
R_3sp3hquMqPGNvRF 
R_a4fdNfDCML6WL4t 
R_1EibHQceAiE1zG9 
R_3FUlNSqnV21Uj6e 
R_0GqMajZqasDdg9b 
R_BVyrmRoO95ewfAd 
We have classified you as a representative of the “news media” requester.  As such, we may charge you for some of our duplication costs, but we will not charge you for our search or review costs; you also are entitled to up to 100 pages of photocopies (or an equivalent volume) for free. See .  If, after taking into consideration your fee category entitlements, our processing costs are less than $50.00, we will not bill you because the cost of collection would be greater than the fee collected. (http://www.ecfr.gov/cgi-bin/text-idx?c=ecfr&sid=0fc3ab3499768eebc2e3691c8cf88dec&rgn=div5&view=text&node=43:1.1.1.1.2&idno=43#43:1.1.1.1.2.7.5.3) 43 C.F.R. § 2.39 See 43 C.F.R. § 2.49(a)(1) .  You can expect to hear from us promptly regarding the outcome of this search. 
You have agreed to pay up to $200.00 for the processing of your request.  If we find that this will not cover the cost of processing your request, we will stop processing your request at the point this amount has been reached and will let you know before we incur additional charges.  You can then either agree to pay the additional amount needed or narrow the scope of your request. 
We use Multitrack Processing to process FOIA requests.  The Simple track is for requests that would generally take one to five workdays to process.  The Normal track is for requests that would generally take six to twenty workdays to process.  The Complex track is for requests that would generally take twenty-one to sixty workdays to process.  The Extraordinary track is for requests that would generally take more than sixty workdays to process.  The Expedited track is for requests that have been granted expedited processing, which are processed as soon as practicable.  Within each track, requests are usually processed on a first-in, first-out basis. 
Your request falls into the Normal processing track.  There are 16 requests pending ahead of yours in our overall processing queue.  Presuming that our current FOIA capacity and burden remain constant, we expect that we will dispatch a determination to you by July 10, 2023. 
You may narrow the scope of your request to obtain quicker processing in your currently-assigned track or move the request into a different track, which may enable us to process it more quickly by communicating with us at foia@usgs.gov. 
The 2007 FOIA amendments created the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) to offer mediation services to resolve disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  Using OGIS services does not affect your right to pursue litigation.  You may contact OGIS in any of the following ways: 
Office of Government Information Services 
National Archives and Records Administration 
8601 Adelphi Road - OGIS 
College Park, MD  20740-6001 
Telephone:  (202) 741-5770 
Fax:  (202) 741-5769 
Toll-free:  1 (877) 684-6448 
E-mail:  ogis@nara.gov 
Web: https://www.archives.gov/ogis (https://www.archives.gov/ogis) 
Please note that using OGIS services does not affect the timing of an appeal with the Department’s FOIA & Privacy Act Appeals Officer. Contact information for the Department’s FOIA Public Liaison, who you may also seek dispute resolution services from, is available at https://www.doi.gov/foia/foiacenters. 
If you have any questions about your request, you may contact me by email at foia@usgs.gov. 
Sincerely, 
Eric J. Darby 
Government FOIA Analyst

communications.subject: DOI-USGS-2023-004943 - Update
communications.communication:
Good morning Mr. Welsh,

The subject matter experts (SME) have located over 50,000-60,000 RGB/multispectral images and multiple videos in response to your FOIA request.  The SME anticipate uploading the records to the following websites by September 2023:

USGS ScienceBased:  https://www.sciencebase.gov/catalog/

            USGS Multimedia Gallery:  https://www.usgs.gov/products/multimedia-gallery

I will keep your request open until I have received confirmation from the SME that all records have been uploaded. I will keep you updated on the upload status of the records.

v/r

Eric J. Darby
Government Information Specialist
U.S. Geological Survey
Email:  edarby@usgs.gov<mailto:edarby@usgs.gov>

communications.subject: DOI-USGS-2023-004943 - Delayed Processing
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Welsh, 
As of yet, we have been unable to make a determination on your request, DOI-USGS-2023-004943.  Our Subject Matter Experts have located over 50,000-60,000 RGB/multispectral images and multiple videos in response to your FOIA request.  Your request falls into the Normal processing track and there are 8 requests pending ahead of yours in this processing track.  We hope to complete our response to you by September 30, 2023. 
We apologize for this delay.  As we have discussed, you may narrow the scope of your request to obtain quicker processing in your currently assigned track or move the request into a different track (which may have the effect of reducing the cost of processing your request and having it processed more quickly).  You also may agree to an alternative time period for processing by communicating with us, our FOIA Requester Center, or the FOIA Public Liaison.  Contact information for the Department’s FOIA Requester Centers and FOIA Public Liaison is available at https://www.doi.gov/foia/foiacenters . You may also seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS).  If you choose to contact OGIS, you may do so in any of the following ways. 
If you choose to contact OGIS, you may do so in any of the following ways: 
Office of Government Information Services 
National Archives and Records Administration 
8601 Adelphi Road – OGIS 
College Park, Maryland  20740-6001 
Telephone:      (202) 741-5770 
Fax:                 (202) 741-5769 
Toll-free:         1-877-684-6448 
E-mail: ogis@nara.gov (mailto:ogis@nara.gov) 
Web: https://ogis.archives.gov (https://gcc02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fogis.archives.gov%2F&data=05%7C01%7Cmruiz%40usgs.gov%7C25416f727ad2427ffec608dac689d1dd%7C0693b5ba4b184d7b9341f32f400a5494%7C0%7C0%7C638040592469937233%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=l7owVncCepLIAZ59Y7z1%2BVSVOPglmQI4wNgMwn2eQF0%3D&reserved=0) 
Although we hope you will wait so we can upload the records to our website, you may file an appeal with the Department’s FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Officer regarding this delay.  If you choose to appeal this delay, you may do so anytime between now and the date we make our determination on the FOIA request.  Appeals arriving or delivered after 5 p.m. Eastern Time, Monday through Friday, will be deemed received on the next workday. Your appeal must be made in writing.  You may submit your appeal and accompanying materials to the FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Officer by mail, courier service, fax, or email.  All communications concerning your appeal should be clearly marked with the words: "FREEDOM OF INFORMATION APPEAL."  You must also include with your appeal copies of all correspondence between you and USGS concerning your FOIA request, including your original FOIA request and USGS's response.  Failure to include with your appeal all correspondence between you and USGS will result in the Department's rejection of your appeal, unless the FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Officer determines (in the FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Officer’s sole discretion) that good cause exists to accept the defective appeal. 
Please include your name and daytime telephone number (or the name and telephone number of an appropriate contact), email address and fax number (if available) in case the FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Officer needs additional information or clarification of your appeal. DOI FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Office Contact Information 
Department of the Interior 
Office of the Solicitor 
Attn: FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Office 
1849 C Street, N.W. 
MS-6556 MIB 
Washington, D.C.  20240 
Telephone:       (202) 208-5339 
Fax:                 (202) 208-6677 
Email: FOIA.Appeals@sol.doi.gov (https://gcc02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmail.google.com%2Fmail%2F%3Fview%3Dcm%26fs%3D1%26tf%3D1%26to%3DFOIA.Appeals%40sol.doi.gov&data=05%7C01%7Cmruiz%40usgs.gov%7C25416f727ad2427ffec608dac689d1dd%7C0693b5ba4b184d7b9341f32f400a5494%7C0%7C0%7C638040592469937233%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=LrbaRT6hTxBwvF7RBFY9Eia3Pk42DgvnG9bPuns%2F8Uc%3D&reserved=0) 
We regret the delay and appreciate your consideration in this matter.  For more information on FOIA Administrative Appeals, you may review the Department’s FOIA regulations at 43 C.F.R. Part 2, Subpart H. 
We appreciate your patience and the good open communication with you regarding this request.  Should you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me at foia@usgs.gov.  I will keep you updated you on the progress of the request. (https://gcc02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmail.google.com%2Fmail%2F%3Fview%3Dcm%26fs%3D1%26tf%3D1%26to%3Dfoia%40usgs.gov&data=05%7C01%7Cmruiz%40usgs.gov%7C25416f727ad2427ffec608dac689d1dd%7C0693b5ba4b184d7b9341f32f400a5494%7C0%7C0%7C638040592469937233%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=pKoyTDhRkSWcrFu5VNtCQXPMRdw4NFuRWEyQTGo0bn0%3D&reserved=0)

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Institutional Press Policies (Arkansas State University)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any policy, guidance, handbook, manual, or standard contract concerning the institution’s interactions or relationship with members of the news media, reporters, or journalists, including but not limited to student journalists. 

2. Any policy, guidance, handbook, or manual concerning the interactions or communications of institutional employees, including faculty, administrators, staff, and student employees, with the news media, reporters, or journalists, including but not limited to student journalists. 

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

This request is made on behalf of the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, a nonprofit and nonpartisan organization that aims to defend and sustain the individual rights of all Americans to free speech and free thought. This request concerns a matter of public interest. The records are sought for the purpose of researching and educating the public about policies affecting student journalists' ability to engage in news gathering and reporting on college and university campuses.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Anne Marie Tamburro.

Sonny Albarado

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Rental Licensing Program Information Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past two years (September 2021-September 2023) regarding your residential rental licensing program that will be referred to as "program"  in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as "Rental Units, Licensing Of" as described in Chapter 96 in Hyattsville city code. 

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Program including but not limited to:

• any training/presentation materials used in communication, promotions, workshops, seminars, etc

• criminal background checks performed on prospective tenants

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the Program

• suspensions or revocation of a residential rental license, against property owners who fail to comply with the requirements of the program

• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the program 

• meeting minutes and correspondence between municipality officials, regarding the implementation and enforcement of the  program

• all documents concerning the passage of the program and any amendments to it, including communications with City elected officials, city staff, and others, and any data relied upon or reviewed as a part of the passage or amendments to the program since September 2021 to September 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: City of Hyattsville, MD - Records Information Request Confirmation PIR-2023-132
communications.communication:
City of Hyattsville, MD - Records Information Request Confirmation PIR-2023-132 
  
 Dear Requestor, 
  
 Thank you for submitting a request for records on Wednesday, September 13, 2023 at 11:45 PM (Eastern Standard Time). 
  
 Your request reference number is Request Number: PIR-2023-132 and your security key is 674764. 
  
 Please have both reference numbers available when communicating with our staff regarding your request. 
  
 The City will begin processing your request shortly. Due to the volume of requests received the City anticipates that it will take longer than 10 working days to produce the responsive records. Under the Maryland Public Information Act, the City will provide a response within 30-days of the request. 
  
 The first two hours of search and review are provided free of charge. Fees for time over two hours may vary depending on the time and hourly rates of the individual staff and attorneys who must conduct the review. The City does not yet know whether the records requested will require review time in excess of two hours but will inform you as soon as possible if they do. If any requested records are to be withheld, the City's response will explain the reason for that. 
  
 To communicate with staff regarding your request, please contact the City Clerk's Office at cityclerk@hyattsville.org or call 301--985-5009. 
  
 Thank you, 
 City of Hyattsville 
 4310 Gallatin Street
3rd Floor
Hyattsville, MD 20781

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Charcoal Briquettes (Environmental Protection Agency)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents, memoranda, emails, correspondence, meeting notes and minutes, presentations, i.e., powerpoint documents relating to:

charcoal briquettes - labeling, composition, consumer complaints, material safety data sheets (SDS), communications with third-parties.

If any clarification or narrowing of request is needed, please contact me. Thank you very much.

Spencer

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Spencer Sheehan

communications.subject: Date Range Needed for FOIA Request EPA-2021-004902
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sheehan, 
This message concerns your Freedom of Information Act request for records related to charcoal briquettes. The EPA is in the process of initiating a document search for records responsive to your request. However, we noticed that the date range was missing from your request. Please provide this information to us at your earliest convenience so that we can proceed with the records search. If you have any questions, feel free to contact me at purifoy.tiffany@epa.gov. (mailto:purifoy.tiffany@epa.gov) 
 
Sincerely, 
Tiffany Purifoy 
Government Information Specialist

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #EPA-2021-004902
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Purifoy,

Thank you for bringing this to my attention. This was one of first FOIA requests I submitted through the Muckrock platform so  did not pay close attention to what was included. 

As for a date range, my goal is not to set a range too big that the job is unmanageable and takes forever.  Also, I don't know what the agency may have, etc.

Let's begin with date range from 1/1/2010 to the present, 7/18/2021 or whatever date I submitted the initial request.

Hopefully this date range is not too wide. If it is too big a time period - it would sweep in thousands of unrelated documents perhaps - let me know and I'll be glad to refine my request. Thank you very much.

Spencer

communications.subject: Extension Letter for EPA-2021-004902
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sheehan: 
This message concerns your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request of June 13, 2021, for records related to charcoal briquettes, as described in your request. 
Pursuant to 40 C.F.R. § 2.104(d), an extension of the due date of your request is necessary due to unusual circumstances. EPA needs additional time to examine a potentially voluminous amount of separate and distinct records, which are requested in a single FOIA and consult with two or more components of the agency having substantial subject matter interest in the records. We anticipate that your request will be completed by October 29, 2021. EPA will submit monthly interim releases of records to you until the completion of your request. 
You may email me at purifoy.tiffany@epa.gov with your response or contact me at (919) 541-0878 if you have any further questions or wish to modify your request. (mailto:purifoy.tiffany@epa.gov) 
Additionally, you may seek dispute resolution services from EPA’s FOIA Public Liaison at hq.foia@epa.gov or (202) 566-1667, or from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS). You may contact OGIS in any of the following ways: email, ogis@nara.gov; telephone, (301) 837-1996 or (877) 684-6448; facsimile (301) 837-0348; or by mail at: 
Office of Government Information Services 
National Archives and Records Administration, Room 2510 
8610 Adelphi Road, College Park, MD 20740-6001 
 
Sincerely, 
 
Tiffany Purifoy 
Government Information Specialist

title: Rockland County District Attorney: Twitter Archive for @RocklandDA Account

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Rockland County District Attorney: Twitter Archive for @RocklandDA Account
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Respectfully, this is a request for the archive of all Twitter Direct Messages, search history, Muted Accounts and Blocked Accounts for the Rockland County District Attorney Twitter account @RocklandDA. The Rockland County District Attorney's office has maintained a Twitter/X account since December 2020. You can find that account here: https://twitter.com/RocklandDA

Twitter (now "X") has long allowed users access to a zip file which includes information. Federal and state agencies have routinely granted requests for twitter archive information. 

For information about how to request the download: 

https://help.twitter.com/en/managing-your-account/how-to-download-your-twitter-archive

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

RE: Response to Request for Records Under the Freedom of Information Law, Reference # R007869-083023 

Dear Mr. Delaware: 
We are writing to acknowledge receipt of your request for records under the Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) dated August 30, 2023.  A copy of your request is included in the electronic portal. 

In accordance with FOIL, our Department will advise you within twenty (20) business days if this Department maintains any records that are responsive to your request and whether this Department will make the records available to you, deny you access to any such records or furnish you with a statement of the approximate date on which the request will be granted or denied. 

Please be further advised that pursuant to Executive Order No. 94-2, as amended by Nos. 04-03 and No. 07-01, which outline the procedures for applications for access to records of the County under FOIL, you have the right to appeal a denial of an application to the Records Access Appeals Officer in the Rockland County District Attorney's Office, 1 South Main Street, New City, New York 10956. 

Very truly yours, 

Christine Reddy 
Substitute Records Access Officer 
Department of District Attorney

September 25, 2023 

Robert Delaware 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR151395 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston, MA 02115 RE: Response to Request for Records Under the Freedom of Information Law (FOIL), Reference # R007869-083023 

Dear Mr. Delaware: 

I am writing regarding your request for records under the Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) dated August 30, 2023.  A copy of your request is included in the electronic portal. Your request seeks the following: “The archive of all Twitter Direct Messages, search history, Muted Accounts and Blocked Accounts for the Rockland County District Attorney Twitter account @RocklandDA. The Rockland County District Attorney's office has maintained a Twitter/X account since December 2020.” 

Please be advised that the records you seek are publicly available on the Twitter/X account of the Rockland County District Attorney's Office. As you are aware, the Rockland County District Attorney's Office created a Twitter account in December 2020. All messages posted on the account since its inception are still live and can be viewed by anyone who accesses the account. No accounts have been muted or blocked. 

Please be further advised that pursuant to Executive Order No. 94-2, as amended by Nos. 04-03 and No. 07-01, which outline the procedures for applications for access to records of the County under FOIL, you have the right to appeal a denial of an application to the Records Access Appeals Officer in the Office of the Rockland County District Attorney, One South Main Street, 5th floor, New City, New York 10956. Scott Benjamin 
Assistant Records Access Officer 
Department of District Attorney

title: Institutional Press Policies (Northwest Arkansas Community College)

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Institutional Press Policies (Northwest Arkansas Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any policy, guidance, handbook, manual, or standard contract concerning the institution’s interactions or relationship with members of the news media, reporters, or journalists, including but not limited to student journalists. 

2. Any policy, guidance, handbook, or manual concerning the interactions or communications of institutional employees, including faculty, administrators, staff, and student employees, with the news media, reporters, or journalists, including but not limited to student journalists. 

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

This request is made on behalf of the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, a nonprofit and nonpartisan organization that aims to defend and sustain the individual rights of all Americans to free speech and free thought. This request concerns a matter of public interest. The records are sought for the purpose of researching and educating the public about policies affecting student journalists' ability to engage in news gathering and reporting on college and university campuses.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Anne Marie Tamburro.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Clyde Bellecourt FBI file
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- all records, including cross-referenced indices and ELSUR files, regarding Native American activist Clyde Bellecourt (May 8, 1936 – January 11, 2022), founder of the group American Indian Movement. Proof of death is not required, as his death has been widely reported: https://www.cnn.com/2022/01/12/us/aim-leader-clyde-bellecourt-dies-85/index.html

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

CJ Ciaramella

Thank you for your request made under the Indiana Access to Public Records Act ('APRA' I.C. 5-14-3 et seq.). 

**We ask that you please reference the Request Form Number on all correspondence with our office.**

Please note that APRA does not require the production of documents within seven days. Rather, APRA provides that the request will be deemed denied if the requester does not receive a response from the state agency within seven days. By way of this notice, we letting you know that the University will initiate a review of your request and relevant files in order to determine what records the University may have that are responsive to your request and must be disclosed under APRA. We will respond to your request once our review is complete.

Sincerely,

Office of the Vice President and General Counsel
Indiana University
  
Your Email Address:  
Email Address: 151845-53307967@requests.muckrock.com  
  
**Your Contact Information**  
Your Name::  Natalie Katsaros

Your Phone Number::  6172991832  
  
**Your Request**  
RECORD(S) BEING REQUESTED::  
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any agreements between Indiana University and Charlotte Aitchison (Charli XCX) regarding her performance on August 21, 2021, including concert riders and other venue specific accommodations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Natalie Katsaros

communications.communication:

The University is in receipt of your below public records request submitted pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act (APRA). Attached please find the record(s) responsive to your request.

The University now considers your request closed.

Office of the Vice President & General Counsel
301 University Blvd, Rm 5030

If you received this transmission in error, please notify the sender by reply e-mail and delete the message and any attachments.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Transgender Incarceration Rates (Bureau of Prisons)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- A complete list of current and former prisoners who identify as Transgender, Nonbinary, Genderqueer, Two Spirit, or Gender-nonconforming. If list is not available, a breakdown 
-Data on assaults against above listed people, both sexual and physical, perpetrated by both inmates and staff.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Katelyn Sahagian

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Untitled (City Of Griffin Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to (O.C.G.A.) §§ 50-18-70 through 50-18-76 I would like to request any and all known records of Troy Everett Ogletree DOB 04/04/1988 to include any records that list him as a witness, suspect, victim, complainant, person of interest or informant. Any contact cards, or any other electronic or tangible document as it relates to the above referenced individual.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kai Jun Hana

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to (O.C.G.A.) §§ 50-18-70 through 50-18-76 I would like to request any and all known records of Troy Everett Ogletree DOB 04/04/1988 to include any records that list him as a witness, suspect, victim, complainant, person of interest or informant. Any contact cards, or any other electronic or tangible document as it relates to the above referenced individual.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kai Jun Hana

title: Guantanamo Periodic Review Board representatives (Department of State)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.  I hereby request the following records:

-The name and job title of your agency's representative on the Periodic Review Board, which is charged with assessing the detainees at Guantanamo Bay. The existence of this Board, as well as your agency's involvement, has been widely reported. The most recent example is here: http://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/jan/28/public-look-guantanamo-detainee-review-board-obama

-All Talking Points memos generated within, or shared with, your agency regarding the Periodic Review Board from January 1, 2011 to the date this request is processed.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Todd Feathers
An acknowledgement letter, stating the request is being processed.
